Uses of Interface
handist.collections.dist.DistributedCollection

  • Packages that use DistributedCollection 
    Package Description
    handist.collections.dist
    Contains the classes handling distributed collections, data relocation, and load balancing facilities.

    • Uses of DistributedCollection in handist.collections.dist

      Classes in handist.collections.dist with type parameters of type DistributedCollection 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DistCollectionSatellite<B extends DistributedCollection<?,? super B>,W extends DistCollectionSatellite<B,W>>
      This class is used to make a distributed object that wraps a Distributed Collection instance and holds some variables on places.
      static class  DistCollectionSatellite.Handle<B extends DistributedCollection<?,? super B>,W extends DistCollectionSatellite<B,W>> 
      interface  DistributedCollection<T,C extends DistributedCollection<T,C>>
      Interface representing the most basic characteristics of a distributed collection
      class  GlobalOperations<T,C extends DistributedCollection<T,C>>
      Class that defines the "Global Operations" that distributed collections propose.
      class  TeamOperations<T,C extends DistributedCollection<T,C>>
      Class which defines the "team" operations that distributed collections provide.
      Classes in handist.collections.dist that implement DistributedCollection 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  CachableChunkedList<T>
      DistCol with additional features allowing it to replicate some range of values held by a process onto other processes
      class  DistBag<T>
      A class for handling objects at multiple places.

      Distributed Map using Long as key and type V as value.
